content.description: Start as low as you can on the Right Edge of the boulder and climb the lip up to the high point in the center of the boulder. There may be some holds on the face for a hand or a foot but they are likely poor, your right heel will be your friend. Pretty consistent the whole way up
content.protection: 2 pads, spot may be nice for the top-out
content.location: Right edge of Solid Around the Edges Boulder

content.description: A little shorter than right edge but you end up in the same place. Start as low as possible on the left lip of the boulder and ride the lip to the top.Â
content.location: Left edge of the Solid Around the Edges Boulder

content.description: The Solid Around the Edges Boulder is an interesting outcrop of light and dark schist (& gneiss?) with some swirly white streaks on it's face. This formation sits on (or real close to) the geologic formation Cameron's line which runs vertically through the eastern portion of the Pleasant Valley area, this may explain why the boulders off of the park road entrance feel and look so distinct from one another. Unfortunately for this boulder, all the face holds are poor quality, though the two sloping edges going up to the high point in the center of the boulder are decently solid and worth a slap if you are in the area.
